thread.title: Council votes unanimously to appoint Sandy Lewis
thread.title_full: Council votes unanimously to appoint Sandy Lewis

title: Council votes unanimously to appoint Sandy Lewis
text:
Council votes unanimously to appoint Sandy Lewis Council votes unanimously to appoint Sandy Lewis By Baker City Herald October 20, 2015 09:29 am 
Sandy Lewis is a Baker City Council member. 
Again. 
Officially. 
Councilors voted 6-0 Monday night to appoint Lewis, a retired registered nurse, to replace Ben Merrill. 
The Council initially considered the matter last week, with Lewis receiving three votes, Randy Daugherty two votes, and Michael Meyers one vote. 
Lewis was sworn in and participated in the rest of the Council's Oct. 13 meeting. 
But City Manager Mike Lee later realized that the city charter requires vacancies on the Council to be filled by appointment by "a majority of the Council." 
With six members, that means a minimum of four votes is necessary to constitute a majority, and Lewis received three votes. 
Before councilors voted during Monday's special meeting, Daugherty and Meyers withdrew as candidates.
